title: B field at points near two wires

content.question: Two long, straight wires are perpendicular to the page and carry currents with equal magnitude into the page, as shown above. Points <math alttext="lowercase a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="lowercase b" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="lowercase c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="lowercase d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are a distance <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on either side of the axes of the wires. Which of the following correctly ranks the magnitude of the magnetic field <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at these points?

choices.label: <math alttext="the magnitude of the field at point a is greater than the magnitude of the field at point b, which is greater than the magnitude of the field at point c, which is greater than the magnitude of the field at point d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the magnitude of the field at point a is greater than the magnitude of the field at point c, which is greater than the magnitude of the field at point b, which is greater than the magnitude of the field at point d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the magnitude of the field at point a equals the magnitude of the field at point c, close parenthesis, which is greater than, open parenthesis, the magnitude of the field at point b, which equals the magnitude of the field at point d, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the magnitude of the field at point a equals the magnitude of the field at point d, close parenthesis, which is greater than, open parenthesis, the magnitude of the field at point b, which equals the magnitude of the field at point c, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, the magnitude of the field at point a equals the magnitude of the field at point d, close parenthesis, which is greater than, open parenthesis, the magnitude of the field at point b, which equals the magnitude of the field at point c, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
